content: seaside bonnet by lison knits the #seasidebonnet is worked using simple knitting techniques stockinette increases decreases and i-cord materials 4mm knitting needles multiple strands of mohair yarn gauge 22 stitches x 31 row = 10x10 cm or dk yarn yarn needle sizes and gauge are not strict abbreviations rs right side m1r make one right k2tog knit two together ws wrong side m1l make one left ssk slip slip knit if the gauge isn t 22 stitches x 31 row = 10x10 cm you can still use this pattern making these adjustments if the gauge is larger or smaller in terms of stitches cast on more or less amount of stitches where the symbol ^ is found if the gauge is longer or shorter in terms of row knit a shorter or longer amount of cm where the symbol * is found pattern cast-on 9 stitches ^ here you can cast on less or more stitches based on your gauge and/or your aesthetic desire this will be the line you see on the middle of your bonnet knit one place a marker knit until the last stitch ^ these are the stitches of the middle line place a marker and knit the last stitch in total 9 stitches purl all stitches in total 9 stitches repeat the following instructions until your work measures 25 cm * this length should be equal to the distance from your jaw to the top of your head - rs knit until first marker m1r slip first marker knit until second marker slip second marker m1l knit until the end of the row - ws purl all stitches every two row you will add 2 stitches knit in stockinette for 4 row repeat the following instructions until you have only 9 stitches ^ or the number of stitches you casted on in the beginning - rs knit until the last 2 stitches before the first maker k2tog slip first marker knit until second marker slip second marker ssk knit until end of the row in total 9 stitches - ws purl all stitches in total 9 stitches every two row you will remove 2 stitches i-cord with 9 stitches on your needles taking stitch markers off k2tog knit 7 stitches ssk in total 7 stitches k2tog knit 7 stitches ssk in total 5 stitches start knitting the i-cord - rs knit all stitches - rs slip all stitches back to the first needle without turning your work repeat until the i-cord measures 45cm ^ this will be one of the cords used to tie the bonnet so you can decide the length based on your aesthetic preferences cast-off all stitches and sew in ends for the second i-cord pick-up 9 stitches k2tog knit 7 stitches ssk in total 7 stitches k2tog knit 7 stitches ssk in total 5 stitches then start knitting the i-cord as described before sew in all ends thank you for sharing and for any questions write to me on instagram @lison
